channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: Darwin hosts its first ever Dreamtime game as Essendon face Richmond in the annual clash which usually takes place at the MCG.
item.title: AFL 2020 Round 13 Live Updates: Irving Mosquito bites twice, but inaccurate Richmond Tigers too good for Essendon Bombers in Darwin Dreamtime clash

item.dc:creator: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon
item.description: The appeal of Exchange-Traded Funds is that they spread relatively small amounts of money across a large number of underlying companies.
item.title: How a novice can cheaply get into the sharemarket

item.description: Your home remains exempt from CGT for six years if you move elsewhere and do not claim another home as your main residence.
item.title: Clarifying Capital Gains Tax rules

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: South Sydney posted the biggest halftime lead in their history before running away with a 56-16 win that effectively ends the Sea Eagles' season.
item.title: Souths produce perfect half of football to sink Manly

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Acting Chief Medial Officer Paul Kelly said that while mystery cases had “mainly been in Melbourne, and mainly related to the community outbreak”, they are decreasing over time.
item.title: As it happened: Victoria records 182 new cases, 13 deaths; Sydney hotel security guard tests positive; New restrictions as Queensland records nine cases

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The Brumbies rammed home their Super Rugby AU title credentials in emphatic fashion with a 38-11 win over the Waratahs,
item.title: 'Pretty comprehensive': Waratahs not world beaters yet as Brumbies come up trumps

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 23, 2020

item.description: Hawthorn coach Alastair Clarkson denied his team was motivated into forging a steelier edge against Port Adelaide following criticism from Garry Lyon, who branded them the "sociable Hawks".
item.title: Hawks win 'just around the corner': Clarkson

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Ben Long couldn’t help but feel a bit jealous over the past week. The original AFL fixture had Long’s St Kilda scheduled to take on Gold Coast in round 13 in Darwin.
item.title: Saint playing the Long game

item.description: From co-founding a circus company at the age of 14 to playing Reddy in the highly anticipated biopic I Am Woman, this Adelaide-raised actor digs deep for each and every project.
item.title: 'I became obsessed': Tilda Cobham-Hervey on the role of her life

item.description: With the exception of Mandarin language courses, tie-ups with Chinese institutions are likely to be discontinued, the officials said.
item.title: India slaps new curbs on visas, schools to stem China influence

item.dc:creator: Jane Rocca
item.description: The musician talks on his career and the women who have influenced him.
item.title: 'I fell in love with her the day I met her': the women in Rick Astley's life

item.description: Plus the actor shares her enduring “toddler” look, and why the 60s is her favourite fashion decade.
item.title: Madeleine Madden on the tweed coat that gets her through every season

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Darling
item.description: To mark the change of season, why not a change of scent? Enter fresh, floral notes as we count down to warmer months.
item.title: The best new fragrances to try this spring

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: From some embarrassing early moments, Mark O'Connor has emerged as a lock for premiership contenders Geelong.
item.title: Cat O'Connor shows pluck of the Irish

item.dc:creator: Nicole Economos
item.description: The chef shares the food that keeps him energised throughout a work day.
item.title: My Day on a Plate: Luke Mangan

item.dc:creator: Adam Liaw
item.description: He’s all grown up but that doesn’t stop Adam Liaw stepping back in time to serve up two favourite dishes from his childhood, with just a few twists.
item.title: Adam Liaw's cauliflower cheese and bacon pasta, and golden syrup wings

item.description: Free weekly horoscope for each star sign from renowned astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Weekly Horoscope for August 23-30

item.description: Sunday Life's gift line-up for Dad has everything he’s ever wished for
item.title: It's a wrap: Sunday Life's Father's Day gift guide

item.dc:creator: Jim Pavlidis
item.description: What can GWS coach Leon Cameron say to inspire his team that he hasn’t already said? Perhaps he can turn a negative into a positive by imploring his team to ‘‘Use Your Disillusion’’.
item.title: It's been a big week in art ... with Jim Pavlidis

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: On the weekend celebrating Indigenous football, Jake Niall provides a subjective ranking of Australian football's 10 most influential Indigenous figures.
item.title: Indigenous footy heroes who led the way

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: The popular reality TV show had production at its Docklands studio shut down on Saturday, after a crew member tested positive to the virus.
item.title: The Masked Singer production shut down after seven COVID-19 cases

item.description: The east coast is being hit by what meteorologists are calling an "Antarctic blob".
item.title: Antarctic blast brings snow to NSW

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Wests Tigers are all but out of the finals race for a ninth straight year after crashing to the premiers 38-16.
item.title: Tigers' finals hopes flicker and fade as fightback falls away

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Tony Popovic's Perth Glory put on an excellent defensive display to restrict Wellington Phoenix and take one of the few chances that came their way to win 1-0.
item.title: Perth Glory through to semis after upset win over Wellington

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The government will spend $110m over the next 18 months on recovery projects for communities in eastern Victoria that were hit by the summer's devastating bushfires.
item.title: Victoria announces $110m long-term bushfire recovery plan

item.description: Port Adelaide's week from hell looked like heading further south when they found themselves ambushed by an angry Hawthorn outfit at Adelaide Oval.
item.title: Hawks fire up but Power prevails

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: A Joel Chianese goal clinched a shock 1-0 win for Perth over Wellington, setting up a clash against the Sky Blues in Wednesday's semi-final.
item.title: Glory set up finals showdown with Sydney FC after upset win over Phoenix

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: World of Photos - August 23, 2020

item.description: Each year around 500 shearers travel to Australia from New Zealand and shear around 7 million sheep but due to Covid-19 travel restrictions that will not happen this year and farmers and shearing contractors have concerns about getting the flock shorn. Photos by Justin McManus
item.title: Australian shearing industry facing shortage of shearers

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: St Kilda coach Brett Ratten thinks the Lions still have a home ground advantage as they prepare for a battle at the Gabba on Sunday.
item.title: Home away from home: Saints rest Clark for top four clash

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: The Melbourne Cricket Club is anticipating a membership revenue shortfall of more than $16 million as the body responsible for managing the MCG battles the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Huge financial hit for MCC on membership revenue

item.description: Graham Payne only has a stable of four runners but his team has hit the ground running this season with two winners from just three starters.
item.title: Payne and gain: Trainer's small team makes big impression

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: The Cox Plate or Melbourne Cup looms for Verry Elleegant after her class and toughness shone through in the Winx Stakes at Randwick on Saturday.
item.title: Verry Elleegant makes spring statement in Winx Stakes

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Victoria has experienced one of the coldest days of the year, with blankets of snow falling in the Dandenong Ranges and Trentham overnight and more on the way.
item.title: Snow, sleet: Victoria battens down for wintry weekend

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Jeremy Finlayson paid the price for the Giants' derby horror show as coach Leon Cameron wielded the axe with the club's season teetering on the precipice.
item.title: 'Nowhere near the mark': Sharpshooter dumped as Giants swing axe

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Tyro Payments founder Jost Stollmann, who has close connections to the Morrison government, was given permission to leave Australia in June to pick up a new luxury yacht in Europe.
item.title: Sydney businessman given travel permit to pick up a luxury yacht

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: After the Victorian government pledged its biggest ever upgrade, the architect behind Federation Square says a permanent, engaging link to the nearby Yarra River is urgent.
item.title: Federation Square designer welcomes $20m upgrade but says river link cannot wait

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The Western Bulldogs defeated the Demons by 28-points on Saturday with a six goal to zero third term the downfall for Melbourne coach Simon Goodwin's men.
item.title: Goodwin laments defensively 'disappointing' Demons

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Chief Health Officer Brett Sutton has urged Victorians to stay the course during strict stage four lockdown measures.
item.title: Melburnians showing signs of lockdown fatigue as cases continue to fall

item.description: It's Taree Cup day on Sunday, and we've got everything you need to pick a winner.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Taree Cup day on Sunday

item.description: When my father first clapped eyes on my mother, the attraction was far from mutual. So how did he win her over?
item.title: The great lengths my father went to in the name of love

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Police have appealed for witnesses after a woman was found dead on a Sunshine Coast hinterland street.
item.title: Man charged with murdering Sunshine Coast woman, 31

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A COVID-19 cluster spreading across Ipswich and Brisbane is expected to grow after thousands were swabbed at fever clinics on Saturday.
item.title: Brisbane braces for coronavirus spread amid rush to trace new cluster

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The AFL will hear the Queensland government's grand final pitch on Tuesday as an increase in COVID-19 cases in the Sunshine State created more uncertainty for the league,
item.title: AFL to hear Queensland grand final bid as uncertainty grows

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Gordon and Randwick remain the only two undefeated sides in the Shute Shield after both posted solid wins on Saturday.
item.title: Gordon thump Hunter but coach maintains Randwick are still favourites

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The hulking Raiders prop produced one of the plays of the year to save a certain try on the Gold Coast.
item.title: Papalii's miracle ankle tap helps Raiders run over Titans

item.description: The 44-year-old politician, one of Vladimir Putin’s fiercest critics, was admitted to an intensive care unit in the Siberian city of Omsk on Thursday.
item.title: Stricken Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny arrives in Germany

item.dc:creator: Sophie Smith
item.description: Richie Porte has reservations that the Tour de France will be completed amid the pandemic but has fully prepared for one more yellow jersey assault.
item.title: Porte readies for last shot at Tour de France title
